name: 2-aminopropane
source: Dreisbach R. R. Physical Properties of Chemical Compounds; Vol. III; American Chemical Society; Washington; 1961.
Reason: 2-Aminopropane has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for this compound is propane, which has a melting point of -18.7 degrees Celsius. The introduction of an amino group (–NH2) increases the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius.
